alert.note: Alert for Lancaster (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 30 at 8:52PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Lancaster. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 849 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.50 and 1.50 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall of less than 0.25 inch is expected over the area. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... Ephrata, New Holland, Akron, Leola, Paradise, Denver, Reamstown, Rothsville, Strasburg, Quarryville, Gap, Adamstown, Terre Hill, Wakefield, Churchtown, Bareville, Leacock, Bowmansville, Reinholds and Lampeter. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
